akn:content.akn:p:
§ 750. Distribution of securities The trustee may not distribute a security except under section 751 of this title. (Pub. L. 95–598, Nov. 6, 1978, 92 Stat. 2614.)
Historical and Revision Notes senate report no. 95–989Section 750 forbids the trustee from distributing a security other than a customer name security. The term “distribution” refers to a distribution to customers in satisfaction of net equity claims and is not intended to preclude the trustee from liquidating securities under proposed 11 U.S.C. 748.
